resources.string: Enter the resistor values separated by commas:

Write the first two color
numbers side by side and
multiply by the third number
but tolerance must be %20.

Write the first two color
numbers side by side and
multiply by the third number
of colors, the result is the
resistance value. Tolerance
is the deviation value.

Same as the fourth band but
write side by side the first,
second, and third color numbers.
The rest is the same as the
fourth band.

The same as the fifth band,
only the sixth color selection,
temperature, was added. It measures
the changing ohms per degree.
(Third color * resistance value)
/1000000.

-Normal-
Black: 0
Brown: 1
Red: 2
Orange: 3
Yellow: 4
Green: 5
Blue: 6
Purple: 7
Gray: 8
White: 9
-Multiplier-
Black: x1
Brown: x10
Red: x100
Orange: x1K
Yellow: x10K
Green: x100K
Blue: x1M
Purple: x10M
Gray: x100M
White: x1G
Gold: %10
Silver: %100
-Tolerance-
Brown: %1
Red: %2
Orange: %0.05
Yellow: %0.02
Green: %0.5
Blue: %0.25
Purple: %0.1
Gray: %0.01
Gold: %5
Silver: %10
-Temperature Coefficient-
Brown: 250ppm/C
Red: 100ppm/C
Orange: 15ppm/C
Yellow: 25ppm/C
Blue: 10ppm/C
Purple: 5ppm/C
Gray: 1ppm/C
